channel.title: Help me invest
channel.description:
Ok guys, i have recently gotten myself a good job with fair pay.
My next step is to use that pay to invest.
Currently i am earning $800 before tax, so about $600 - $650 a week goes to my bank account.
i spent between $50 and $100 of that a week.
So, realisticaly i am looking at $500 saved a week. so $2000 a month.
Now, does anyone have any ideas of how i should invest my money. I am willing to invest anywhere between $1000 and $20,000, and am looking for a return of at least 10% for my time, aswell as speed. I know there are risks with investing, and the bigger the risk the bigger the payout.
so hit me with your ideas. And lets make me richer

item.title: Help me invest
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:

In any case we don’t have the same amount of water available, because with the massive population it is being put to use in cars, people etc.

It dosen’t just disappear.
[/quote]

Fresh water is being used up at a fast rate though :(.
Apparently in (i can’t remember how many years because i tend to fall asleep in the assemblys in school) its all gonna go and were all gonna die lol.

SO GET THE BUCKETS READY AND PRESERVE WATER FROM THE TAPS![/quote]
who doesnt fall asleep inthose assemblies

item.title: Help me invest
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Have you taken a drink of water?

Well 60-70% of our bodies is water, average weight is around 80kg, 6.5b people which is 300-350 million liters. Not much but combined with other things it adds up quickly.
Also, less than 1% of the worlds water is clean enough to use, which means to get more we need treatment plants which are expensive, which is why I think investing in the biggest water companies would be a good idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me invest
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Playing the stockmarket is tricky and you really cannot just purchase stocks that are doing well. In my short experience I have earned myself about a 60% loss.

AMD - I picked this up after Hector Ruiz dropped off and there was talk about them moving to Albany ny. Unfortunately it appears that they are still laying off jobs big time and the stock goes down a little everyday.

Freddie mac, Fannie May - I picked both of these up when I heard about the bailout They went up almost a dollar each but I held them (being greedy) well Ill share the results about this one since its such an epic fail

Symbol: FRE
Amount purchased: 200
Price Paid: $7.95
Total Gain: -$1,428.99 -89.26%
Market Value: $172.00

Symbol: FNM
Amount purchased: 200
Price Paid: $14.57
Total Gain: -$2,760.50 -94.07%
Market Value: $174.00

Now here is the reason I didn’t jump off the tallest building in tampa I also picked up GNBT Which has gained 94% value in the past few weeks.

Other stocks i’m hanging onto include YGE(A solar power company in china) WAMUQ (Recently bought out by Chase) TEC (Teton Energy Corp) these stocks havnt shown any huge gain or loss but I predict each of these doing something as soon as the market starts to recover.\

However I do not invest in stock alone I also Have just recently purchased a small home and I rent it out, I plan to keep doing one house a year for the next 3 years. The reasoning behind this Is the housing market is at a all time low you can pick up a small House here in Florida for a little over $50,000 in a decent neighborhood (no im not talking about the south side of any major city) In three years if the market picks up at all these homes should be around the $80,000 price range as in the past (about 2 years ago).

My safest investment by far is CD’s pick up a few with larger sums of money.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me invest
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

sanga282:

i said in the future not now. With the exponential growth of the population being what it is, that will sson end up being more and more needed, for the industry and to drink. That amount available will diminish very quickly as we continue to expand, and what about animals? the marine life in the lakes and seas need a habitat and other animals need to drink. Algae, being th biggest air recycler on the planet, thrives in water.

Our population isn’t growing exponentially. Infact the rate of increase is now decreasing.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me invest
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Let’s assume there are 6 billion people on the earth. The need 2 liters a day, so that’s a total need of 12 billion liters or 12.000.000.000 liters. According to http://science.howstuffworks.com/question157.htm there is a total of 1.260.000.000.000.000.000.000 liters of water on the earth. This water is in a constant cycle.

                  12.000.000.000 liters needed.

1.260.000.000.000.000.000.000 liters available.

Of course the industry needs water too, and that gets polluted. But in Europe and the Americas water pollution is illegal, and cleaning water is getting easier every year.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me invest
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:49, topic:247696”]sanga282, do you realize how much water there is on this planet? Did you know that there is a water cycle?

You drink the water, you then either piss it out again or sweat. So the water you drank gets back into your surroundings. The same applies to all other uses of water. Water doesn’t disappear.[/quote]
so what happens when all of that water is needed at once to give the population a drink? you dont seem to understand the scale on which im talking do you? There can only be a cycle if there is an equal amount of give and take at the right time intervals. If all the planet needs water it will take longer for that to re-enter the cycle. So there will be a backlog.

[quote=“Squigglyo, post:48, topic:247696”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=326703.msg2567913#msg2567913 date=1228500457]
richer countries like the US
[/quote]

this mad me lul.

If America is rich at negative 17 trillion dollars, then i must be so fucking rich at around $0[/quote]
ok perhaps i should’ve used the term: more developed countries

Read full topic

item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

sanga282, do you realize how much water there is on this planet? Did you know that there is a water cycle?

You drink the water, you then either piss it out again or sweat. So the water you drank gets back into your surroundings. The same applies to all other uses of water. Water doesn’t disappear.
